fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1517].
  {panel}

Allow customers with JIRA Users global permission to access requests through JIRA instead of customer portal

*As an administrator*, I would like my customers, who also have JIRA Users global permission, to be able to access Service Desk requests from the regular JIRA interface instead of having to go to the customer portal. 

*As a customer*, who also uses JIRA as a JIRA User, I would like to be able to access Service Desk requests reported by myself.
* I need to be able to search for requests in issue navigator. 
** For example, when searching using JQL "reporter = currentUser()" all of my JIRA issues should be returned, including Service Desk requests.

*Use Example:*
* As a customer, I have create issue permission to a Service Desk project and created a new Service Desk Request using JIRA's create issue interface. I am now unable to find that issue when searching in issue navigator. I should be able to find the issue I reported.

----

This feature request is to make it so that they can at least "access" the issues from JIRA, and does not seek to specify how that access is given.
* For example: When accessing an issue from JIRA, the customer could be taken to the JIRA issue view or they could be directed to the issue in the Customer Portal. 
* Please feel free to add comments to this suggestion with how you would like to see this access implemented

One workaround that is currently in use would be JIRA administrators giving customers Browse Project permission so that the customers can view issues in JIRA. This causes Service Desk permission errors to appear and also gives customers access to internal comments.
fields.summary: Allow customers with JIRA Users global permission to access requests through JIRA instead of customer portal
Customizable Agent Signatures

h3. Summary
Paging does not work properly in Customer Portal view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Test Customer in a test instance
# Have Test Customer create 10 requests & Add him as Request Participants in 30 other requests
# In Customer Portal view, *Created by me* lists the 10 requests and *Created by others* shows the first 20 requests
# Clicking page 2, *Created by me* lists 0 issues and *Created by others* list does not change 

h3. Expected Results
- 2nd page should show the remaining 10 issues for *Created by others*

h3. Actual Results
- The list does not change on the 2nd page for *Created by others*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1512].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Apply JIRA Service desk to an existing project that has 30 days+ old issues.
# Navigate to the SLA reports in JIRA Service Desk and select SLA met vs breached report.

h3. Expected Behavior:

The report should present the breached issues for the past 7 days, 14 days, 30 days, etc accordingly.

h3. Actual Behavior:

The report is actually counting older issues as breached with the date the service desk was applied to the project and not with the correct date when it was really breached.

As you can see on the screenshot below, the project in question had breached issues on October 2014. After applied the the Service Desk to this project it's now counting as breached with the date the Service Desk was applied to the project (Feb 13th).

!Breached.png!

!Report.png!

h3. Workaround:

No available workarounds.
fields.summary: SLA Report not working as expected (SLA met vs breached)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1511].



*UPDATE 7th December 2020*

*Hello everyone,*

*We appreciate the merit of this issue, but wanted to update you all that at this point in time, it is not on our roadmap in the foreseeable future. The solution here is not as straight forward as we would have liked and we are intending to bring many other improvements to the product that are at this point prioritised higher than this one.*
*We will be reviewing this again within 6-12 months and will continue to update on this ticket, so stay tuned.*

*Thanks again,*

*Liron Deutsch*

*Product Manager, Jira Service Management*
{panel}
 

 
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when users go to _Settings -> Request types --> Edit fields --> Add a field_, *Request Participant* field is not in the list even they've added this field to the issue type by editing the create screen for this project..
h3. Suggested Solution

As a user, I'd like to display _Request Participant_ field in the _Create Issue_ screen in customer portal.
h3. Why this is important

It would save a considerable amount of time to be able to add participants while creating the ticket instead of sharing it later.
h3. Workaround

Share the ticket with the request participants after the ticket is created.
fields.summary: Allow adding Request Participant field into Create Issue screen in Customer Portal

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1505].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JSD should not consider comments without the {{sd.public.comment}} attribute as internal comments, but as public comments. Only comments with the entity property set to false should be considered private.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk enabled project;
# Create a customer request;
# Add a comment as an external AC or a P2 addon

h3. Expected Results
The comment should be added as public.

h3. Actual Results
the issue becomes shown as an Internal comment which is not accurate
 
h3. Notes
I suspect the reason this occurs is because the Comment did not have an entity property {{sd.public.comment}} which is what JSD seems to use to differentiate between internal and public comments.
fields.summary: Comments added to issues by addons are listed as internal by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1497].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

when a user that does not exist in JIRA as a Service Desk Customer sends an email to a Service Desk, the user receives an invite to sign up for the Service Desk as a Customer. JIRA Service Desk should allow for JIRA Service Desk Administrators to chose whether or not they want customer accounts to be automatically created. Subsequently instead of sending an invite, an email should be sent asking them to finish the signup process.

h3. Environment
Server / Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce current behavior
# Send an email to a Service Desk you do not have access to or do not exist in as a Service Desk Customer

h3. Expected Results
- If the Service Desk Administrator has not selected the option, you should receive an email asking you to sign up for the specific Service Desk
- If the Service Desk Administrator has selected the option, you should receive an email asking you to complete the signup process


h3. Actual Results
- JIRA Service Desk automatically sends an email asking you to sign up for the specific Service Desk

h3.Workaround
Current JIRA Service Desk Administators can manually create accounts for users and then manually add them to the JIRA Service Desk Customers role
fields.summary: Ability to add JIRA Service Desk Customers automatically when issues are created via email
Ability to remove "Forgotten your password" or Contact Administrator type links from logon screen

  {panel}

In some cases, a customer may have more than one email (a personal email, and a company email for example.)

If a Service Desk administrator creates a customer profile for the company email, the Service Desk requests will be associated with this user profile.
If the customer sends an email to Service Desk with his personal email, it will create another user profile, and will have Requests different requests associated with each user profile.

As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to merge the customer profiles, to avoid confusion when a customer have more than one email, then the customer will be able to see requests from both profiles.
fields.summary: Ability to merge customer profile

The following is a good feature to have 

When an SD project is associated to an email, the mail handler will scan the mail contents to look for key words. Then they will auto-assign the tickets based on these key words. For example:
* If an email is received with the word ‘hardware’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Anna Smith
* If an email is received with the word ‘software’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Jim Jones
* If an email is received with the word ‘password’ the ticket will be automatically assigned to Anil Kim

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 28th October 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all, 

Thanks for everyone for their feedback here. We are currently working on this and will post an update once we have an ETA. Apologies for the delay, we have had to shuffle some priorities around to get onto this, but we are working on:
# Enabling @ mentions on the portal for end users
# Enabling agents to @ mention request participants

I'll provide an update in the coming weeks as this moves from design to engineering. 

Best regards,

Jehan Gonsalkorale

Product manager, Jira Service Management
{panel}

h3. Summary

When adding a comment to a JIRA Service Desk request, the @mention feature does not work for customers or request participants unless those users have permission to browse the project (basically being considered agents) or if they have made a comment on the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Service Desk
 # Have a customer create a request
 # As an administrator, view the issue in the Issue Navigator
 # Type a comment and use the @mention feature to mention the customer

h3. Desired Results
 * A list of suggestions will appear which you can choose the customer or request participant

h3. Actual Results
 * A list of users appears but this list does not contain the customer or any request participants
 ** Agents and collaborators do appear in the list. Any customers and request participants who are agents or collaborators will appear.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Unable to @mention Customer or Request Participant

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA + JSD project running
# Turn JSD notification on
# Raise a ticket on customer's behalf (set customer as the reporter)
## Comment on this issue
## Change issue's status

*Expected Results:*
# Reporter/Customer should be notified when a comment is added on the issue (3.1)
# Reporter/Customer should be notified when there is a change in the request's status (3.2)

*Actual Results:*
# No notification is sent to Reporter/Customer regarding the issue.

*Workaround:*
-Disable JIRA Service Desk notification (Cog Icon > Add-ons > JIRA Service Desk Configuration), this way, JIRA notification scheme will work as defined for all events and users.-

*Notes:*
The notifications aren't working for Request Participants as well.

Documentation of JSD Notifications: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+JIRA+Service+Desk+notifications
fields.summary: Reporter/Customer doesn't receive any notification when ticket is created on his/her behalf (JIRA + JSD)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1464].
  {panel}

As the administrator of one or more service desks, I would like the ability to enable and disable access to the portal during maintenance periods and other times where customers/agents should not be able to access the portal. 
* As the administrator I should be able to access the portal while customer/agent access is disabled
* I need to be able to disable access for only customers or both agents and customers
** Use Case: I am training my agents on a new service desk and want it available to agents without being available to customers
fields.summary: Ability to enable and disable customer and/or agent access to portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1463].
  {panel}

At the moment, after SLA stops, any changes in the issue will not automatically adjust SLA counted.

For example:
- Issue is initially created with priority Major which has SLA of *4 hours*. 
- After resolving the issue (after *3 hours of work*, and the resolution is set), SLA will stop and be marked as *MET*. Since it's resolved within the SLA
- If the customer later changes the priority to Blocked (which has *1 hour* of SLA), the SLA is still considered as *MET* and it is not automatically adjusted as *BREACHED*

Customer might implement or use SLA in different scenario. It would be better to allow them to choose if they want the SLA to be automatically adjusted when they edit the issue (priority) even after the SLA has stopped.
fields.summary: Allow SLA to be automatically adjusted when user changes issue priority even after the SLA stops.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1459].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms
The columns in the JIRA Service Desk queue are not being displayed.
!columns_due_date_hidden.png!

Looking into the Javascript Console, the error below can be seen.
!Console.png!

There are no errors in the JIRA nor in the Service Desk logs.

h3. Steps to Replicate
Hide any of the fields configured as columns in the Service Desk Queue from on the Field Configuration screen.

In the screenshot below, hiding any of the fields below (e.g. Due date, Reporter, Summary) in the [Field Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Specifying+Field+Behavior#SpecifyingFieldBehavior-Hidingorshowingafield] screen would cause this error.
!columns_okay.png!

h3. Workaround
Make the fields associated to the affected Service Desk project queue visible.
fields.summary: Columns missing on service desk queue due to hidden fields on selected columns
As a customer portal user I need to know the request type of a submitted request
Missing translation variable replacement in comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1455].
  {panel}

JSD throws error "Error when turning on e-mail - Failed to establish connection to the Atlassian Cloud mail store

To replicate issue - Service Desk->NYCIRB->Settings->Email Setttings
Click Turn it on

This error is through for all Service Desk projects in our space.
fields.summary: Get error when clicking "Turn It on" to turn on e-mail for SD projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1454].
  {panel}

I created a couple of SD customers, that are not jira users, for our restricted jira service desk and:

- they did not receive any email from jira service desk
- if they send an email to the JSD mail account (mail configuration is set as ON), no request is opened.

Note that customers that are also SD agents can open requests via email without any problems.
fields.summary: SD customers not able to open a request via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1453].
  {panel}

In our JIRA Service Desk, when an agent sends a comment, the status in the workflow does not change.
However, when the agent is making a comment to a user, the user does not receive any notification.
When the user is making a comment, the agent receives the notification.
The user only receives a notification when the agen clicks on the button "Respond to customer".
I have checked in the settings, for issue commented, all watchers, current assignee and the reporter are receiving a notification.
I have checked with the notification helpder as well, the user should receive a notification for issues commented.

Another strange issue is if a third participant is making a comment, the user receives this comment.
The user simply does not receive any comments coming from the agent (assignee).

Where could I have forgotten to set something ?

Thanks in advance for your help !
fields.summary: [No notifications sent to user after a comment from an agent]
Unable to translate People involved field in Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1451].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Customer does not have an option to export their reported request to xls 

*Feature Request*
Ability of JIRA Service Desk customer to export reported request to xls
fields.summary: Ability of JIRA Service Desk customer to export reported request to xls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1450].
  {panel}

Under the Email settings, customers are unable to create email addresses containing a hyphen {{-}} symbol. It throws the below error message: 
*Failed to establish connection to the Atlassian Cloud mail store*.

*Workaround*
Avoid using a hyphen {{-}} symbol in your Email address name.
fields.summary: Unable to create an email with a hyphen (-) in the Email settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1449].
  {panel}


Include in Find a Solution results suggested request types for new request creation


I am the administrator of multiple Service Desks with many Request Types:
* I would like for the Find a Solution box to suggest request types for new requests to be created in.
** "It would be helpful if it searches the request types too as when you have a bunch of service desks it would be hard to find which one is the right place for it."
* I should be able to set a default Request Type that will show if the search returns no matches. 


I am a customer using a Service Desk Portal containing multiple Service Desks with a many Request Types: 
* I would like to use the Find a Solution box to search for solutions and if none are found, create a new request by selecting a suggested Request Type.
** "Which one do I choose?"
fields.summary: Include in Find a Solution results suggested request types for new request creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1448].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently Service Desk Collaborators' can only comment internally. Usually, the comment contains the answer which Service Desk Agents have to copy the comment and add a duplicate comment to make the answer visible to customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a functionality, which allows agents to choose whether a collaborator's comment to be visible to customers.
fields.summary: Permission for Agent to make Collaborators' comment to be public

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1447].
  {panel}

After created a service desk using the "Enable for existing Project" and picked one of the existing Jira projects.
I keep getting this error once I start testing from "Preview customer Portal" 
=====================
Error!
Not able to create issue via this Service Desk.
===============
Note: That I am both the user, admin, for that group
fields.summary: Error!  Not able to create issue via this Service Desk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1445].
  {panel}

It seems like a regression from previous solved requests:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-830
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-55

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a JIRA Service Desk
# Import issues from CSV or create issues using JIRA Create button into the Service Desk project.
# Set the reporter to be one of your Service Desk customers

*Expected Behavior*
The issue created/imported through JIRA would be displayed under "My Requests" in the customer portal.

*Actual Behavior*
The issue is only visible through JIRA.
The Service Desk customer do not have access.

Also, any communication in the issues created/import via JIRA do not trigger an email notification to the involved people.
fields.summary: Issues created using JIRA create button, or CSV import, do not appear under "My Requests" of JIRA Service Desk. Also, the email communication does not work for those issues.
As a Customer I Should be able to search all Request Forms available.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1443].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
* SLA for tickets won't display in the queue, while when seeing the ticket individually, they show up accordingly.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a service desk
* Create a ticket with SLA
* Open the queue to check

*Expected Result*
* SLA would be displayed in the queue

*Actual Result*
* SLA is not displayed in the queue and the following is displayed in the logs:
{noformat}
2014-03-28 04:53:03,559 ajp-bio-8009-exec-7 ERROR rzaddem 293x71346x1 18a591t 10.216.26.53 /rest/api/2/issue/SD-282/comment [servicedesk.internal.util.SafeRunner] Unable to run event handler SLA field indexing - addDocumentFieldsSearchable
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: start < stop
{noformat}

*Workaround*
* This error seems to be related with server time sync, since disabling the sync fixes the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk queues causing SLA errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1442].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
* Create a User picker field 
* On Issue Create event (Notification Scheme for SD), add the User Custom Field Value and choose the user picker field
* Add this field in the Customer Portal
* Create the SD request and fill in the user picker field with a SD customer

h5. Expected Result:
* SD customer specified in the user picker field should receive a notification when the issue gets created

h5. Actual Result:
* No notification has been received by the SD customer while reporter was able to get it.

Additional Information:
* Other notifications are working fine and received by the SD customer (user picker field)
fields.summary: Issue Creation doesn't Notify the User specified in the User picker field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1441].
  {panel}

We already made some small improvements to our plugins (custom fields mainly) so they can be used in JSD too, but it is hard without having either a public API or the source code.
We had also an extention do we can make JIRA tickets in the customer portal, but we would like to do more.
As more and more customers come to JSD they will need more sophisticated creation pages or dashboards.

Is there any plan on opening JSD for the developers?
fields.summary: JSD plugin development

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1437].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
KB article that was created from *Create KB Article* button in Service Desk request, doesn't link the article back to the request itself

h4. Environment
*JIRA 6.3.13* and *JSD 2.2.0*

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk request
# Click the *Create KB article* button
# Complete the KB creation, and then click *Save*

h4. Expected Results
JIRA will create link from the Service Desk request to the KB article

h4. Actual Results
The link was not created
fields.summary: Create KB Article doesn't link Service Desk request with KB
Ability to set default request types

fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk failing to enable after licensing in JIRA Cloud
RSS Feed for Service Desk Customer Requests
Cannot save non-Latin values in "Status name to show customer"
Service Desk email addresses with "-" in raises unhelpful error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1422].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA Service Desk it is not possible to assign any request type to sub-task therefore sub-task is not visible for customer and customer can't receive any notification when sub-task is updated.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JSD Agent, It would be nice to be able to tag sub-tasks with a request type so that customers will receive customer facing updates and ticket transition notifications by email when the subtasks are updated.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks as an applicable issue type for Request Types
SLA Stop by "Left Status"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1419].
  {panel}

Steps:

1. Go to Settings > Request types and then click Edit fields for any of request types.
2. Fill in Display names in Russian, Greek or some other language using a non-Latin alphabet. (you can copy and paste this: "Описание").
3. Save and refresh.

Result:

When a user has whitespace in the username, if he enters Service Desk Customer Portal and starts typing something, a red text saying "Something went wrong, either your query is invalid or we cannot contact the knowledge base" appears under the input field. {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1406].
  {panel}

Service Desk reporting allows series to include reports on different different elements of a service desk. However, if the SLA used is also selected in the drop down, the report reports differently. 

Duplication Steps:
# Create a Service Desk
# Set up an SLA for "Time to Resolved"
# Got to *Reports* for the Service Desk
# Set up a report for '"Time to Resolved"
# Add two series:
## JQL:  issuetype = issueType AND status = Resolved
## JQL:  issuetype = issueType 
(i) Values returned in each series will differ although they are set by the same SLA and jql with 'status = Resolved' is simply asking for what should be whats already included.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1393].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Updateed 24th Jun 15}
Hi all,

We have categorised this issue as a suggestion because the email handler infrastructure we have chosen for JIRA Service Desk does not support this functionality. To allow support for the various suggested functionality for email will require a major re-work of our email handler infrastructure. This is currently not on our immediate roadmap as we are looking to deliver more requested features such as email customisation. However, the simplification of our email and configurations is something we will look into in the future, and we will be working on aligning our email configuration and behaviour closer with JIRA’s.

— JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}


*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Navigate to the "Priorities" page and set "Minor" as the Default Priority.
# Create a new Dummy ServiceDesk Project.
# Configure the Email Settings of the Project.
# Sent out an Email with High Importance(This is for Microsoft Outlook) to the ServiceDesk Email.
# Wait until the issue is processed.

*Expected Results*:
Like the Standard JIRA Incoming Mail Handler, the Email priority would be higher than the Default Priorty.

*Actual Results*:
ServiceDesk will follow the Default Priority regardless of the Email Priority.

*Notes*:
* Tested in JIRA and it works so far.
* JIRA Incoming Mail handler [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-issuecommentcreationIssue/commentcreation]
* The Header of the test email:
{noformat}
From: "xxxx" <xxxx@gmail.com>
To: <xxxx@gmail.com>
Subject: testing service desk priority
Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2015 23:35:11 +0800
Message-ID: <001d01d034c6$cf1f2c40$6d5d84c0$@gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="----=_NextPart_000_001E_01D03509.DD430880"
X-Priority: 1 (Highest)
X-MSMail-Priority: High
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook 14.0
Importance: High
Thread-Index: AdA0xqZ5ulBpecvDTB2UxWnXYaA5YQ==
Content-Language: en-us
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1388].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update on April 12, 2016 --  Signup is avaiable on the help center}
Hi everyone, 
The signup option is now available on the help center when there is at least one service desk project that has public signup enabled. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Cheers,
JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The Help Center link does not allow users to sign up to JSD even when all its portals have [public access enabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Configuring+public+signup#Configuringpublicsignup-Openingyourservicedeskupforpublicsignup].
 While browsing the Help Center only the login prompt is displayed, whereas the individual customer portals offer both login, and signup pages.
h3. Suggested Solution

If any customer portal allows for anonymous signup, then the option should be available when the Help Center is accessed.

  {panel}

When registering for an account, if users do not fulfill the password policy set by admin, the error returned is generic hence user doesn't know what they are doing wrong.

Error Message: "You must specify a password that satisfies the password policy."

Could this be improved by preferably making it  like JIRA, show details of what is expected in a password in the error returned.

Ismael.

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1383].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
The number of Issues displayed in queues is always fifty (50) and it cannot be increased

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option for users to increase the number of issues displayed in queue

h3. Why this is important
It makes it easier to search through the list if it contains all of the Issues currently in the respective queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1382].
  {panel}

We implement the service desk in a project to run in parallel with the vertygo SLA, and found a possible bug that causes a malfunction in the SLA Service Desk to use at the same time with the SLA Vertigo, since when the issue is completed, the SLA Service Desk is automatically opened again and if we close the issue, JIRA Service SLA starts again.

The rules in Vertygo SLA is the same of JIRA Service Desk, so, if Vertygo SLA is closed, JSD necessarily must be closed too, but it's not happened.

In attachments, we can see the JSD SLA - Triagem CSSP is concluded but, SLA - CSSP from Vertygo SLA is running.
Image 1 and 2: Vertygo SLA is different from JIRA Service Desk SLA.
Image 3: JIRA Service Desk works fine without Vertygo SLA.

It's necessary to use both add-ons, because our client need to compare the functionalities and rastreability. There is conflict using JIRA Service Desk and Vertygo SLA in the same issue?
fields.summary: SLA conflict using JIRA Service Desk and the VertygoSLA at the same time
Create a way to disable comments from email vs creating issues from email and vice versa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1378].
  {panel}

In the main portal page you are automatically adding the text "Welcome to the" in front of whatever the support portal is named in the new SD configuration setup for 2.2.

Unfortunately, depending on what people have named their support system previously this can lead to grammatical issues.

i.e. our service request system has always been called ServicePoint. Now seeing "Welcome to the ServicePoint" doesn't sound correct.

Can you stop adding the "Welcome to the" text or make the entire header text configurable please.
fields.summary: Change Welcome text in main portal
Rename Project Role "Service Desk Team" to "Service Desk Agents"
